summary: William Brown was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in payroll records and related documentation from 1977 and 1978. The documents include payroll certifications, payroll authorization forms, and internal memos related to his employment and payroll certification. The documents do not specify his exact role within the HSCA, but his presence in payroll records indicates he was a staff member during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: William Brown's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed, his presence in payroll records confirms his involvement with the committee's work.
